contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Phascolarctidae<ref name=msw3>{{MSW3 Groves|pages=43}}</ref> | fossil_range = {{Fossil range|Late Oligocene|Recent}} | image = Koala climbing tree.jpg | image_width = 250px | image_caption = ''[[Phascolarctos cinereus]]'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Mammal]]ia | infraclassis = [[Marsupial]]ia | ordo = [[Diprotodontia]] | subordo = [[Vombatiformes]] | familia = '''Phascolarctidae''' | familia_authority = [[Richard Owen|Owen]], 1839 | subdivision_ranks = [[Genus|Genera]] | subdivision = †''[[Invictokoala]]''<br> †''[[Litokoala]]''<br> †''[[Koobor]]''<br> †''[[Perikoala]]''<br> †''[[Nimiokoala]]''<br> †''[[Madakoala]]''<br> ''[[Phascolarctos]]'' }} The '''Phascolarctidae''' (''Phasco'' - pouch or bag, ''larct''- from the Greek ''arctos'' meaning bear) are a family of [[Marsupialia|marsupials]] of the order [[Diprotodontia]], consisting of only one extant species, the [[koala]], and six well-known fossil species, with another five less well known fossil species, and two fossil species of the genus ''Koobor'', whose taxonomy is debatable but are placed in this group. The closest relatives of the Phascolarctidae are the [[wombat]]s, which comprise the family [[Vombatidae]]. The fossil record of the family dates back to the [[Middle Miocene]]<ref>{{cite book | author = Benton, M.J. | title = Vertebrate Palaeontology | publisher = Oxford | year = 2005 | pages = 314}}</ref> or [[Late Oligocene]].<ref name=Black2012/> ==Classification== '''Family Phascolarctidae'''<ref name=msw3/> * Genus †''[[Nimiokoala]]'' **†[[Riversleigh rainforest koala]] - ''Nimiokoala greystanesi'' * Genus †''[[Invictokoala]]''<ref name=Invictokoala>{{Cite journal|author=Gilbert J. Price and Scott A. Hocknull |year=2011 |title=''Invictokoala monticola'' gen. et sp. nov. (Phascolarctidae, Marsupialia), a Pleistocene plesiomorphic koala holdover from Oligocene ancestors |journal=Journal of Systematic Palaeontology |volume=9 |issue=2 |pages=327–335 |doi=10.1080/14772019.2010.504079 }}</ref> **†''Invictokoala monticola'' * Genus †''[[Madakoala]]'' **†''Madakoala robustus'' **†''Madakoala wellsi'' **†''Madakoala devisi'' * Genus †''[[Litokoala]]'' **†''Litokoala garyjohnstoni'' **†''Litokoala kutjamarpensis'' **†''Litokoala kanunkaensis'' * Genus †''[[Koobor]]'' **†''Koobor jimbarrati'' **†''Koobor notabilis'' * Genus †''[[Perikoala]]'' **†''Perikoala palankarinnica'' **†''Perikoala robustus'' * Genus ''[[Phascolarctos]]'' **†''Phascolarctos maris'' **[[Koala]] - ''Phascolarctos cinereus'' **†[[Giant koala]] - ''Phascolarctos stirtoni'' **†''Phascolarctos yorkensis'' (formerly ''Cundokoala yorkensis'')<ref name=Talent>{{cite book|author=Talent, John A.|year=2012|title=Earth and Life|publisher=[[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]]|page=1047|isbn=9789048134281}}</ref> * Genus †''[[Priscakoala]]'' **†''Priscakoala lucyturnbullae''<ref name=Black2012>{{cite journal | author = Karen Black, ''et al.'' | year = 2012 | title = New Tertiary koala (Marsupialia, Phascolarctidae) from Riversleigh, Australia, with a revision of phascolarctid phylogenetics, paleoecology, and paleobiodiversity | journal = Journal of Vertebrate Paleontology | volume = 32 | issue = 1 | pages = 125–138 | doi = 10.1080/02724634.2012.626825}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} <!-- please inline this reference *Walton, D. W. Ed. 1987. ''[http://www.deh.gov.au/biodiversity/abrs/publications/fauna-of-australia/1b-contents.html Fauna of Australia]'', Volume 1A. Australian Government Publishing Service, Canberra. ISBN 0-644-06055-7 --> ==External links== *[http://koalas.org/koala-info.html Koalas with evolutionary information]. {{Diprotodontia|V.}} {{Wikispecies|Phascolarctidae}} [[Category:Vombatiforms]] [[Category:Koalas]] {{Diprotodont-stub}}
